title: U.S. Air Force and German air traffic controllers collaborate on unmanned aircraft systems in Germany
originSummary: The U.S. Air Force and German air traffic controllers have collaborated to discuss the safe operation of unmanned aircraft systems near airports in Germany.
The discussions aimed to establish procedures and regulations that prioritize airspace safety.
This collaboration seeks to ensure the safe integration of unmanned aircraft systems into the airspace surrounding airports in Germany.

title: Arlington County Seeks Input on Drone Program for Public Safety
originSummary: Arlington County is developing a joint Unmanned Aircraft Systems (UAS) program aimed at improving the response to public safety and emergency incidents using drones.

The county is actively seeking community input on draft policies that will govern the training, operations, and oversight of the program, with the goal of creating model policies that adhere to legal and regulatory requirements.
The program is scheduled to be launched in early 2024 and will be limited to specific public safety missions.

title: Arlington County seeks feedback on new drone program
originSummary: Arlington County in Virginia is soliciting public input on a new drone program for first responders.
The program is a collaborative effort between multiple departments and aims to enhance the county's emergency response capabilities.
Draft policies have been formulated, covering training, operations, oversight, and the use of digital evidence obtained from drone flights.
The program is scheduled to launch in early 2024, following the incorporation of community feedback.

title: Global UAV Market to Reach $106.49B by 2032: Emergen Research
originSummary: The global Unmanned Aerial Vehicle (UAV) market is expected to reach USD 106.49 billion by 2032, growing at a compound annual growth rate of 14.5%.
The increasing adoption of commercial drones and their applications in urban air mobility, drone delivery services, and agriculture are driving market growth.

Technological advancements, longer flight durations, and improved autonomy are contributing to the expansion of the UAV market. North America currently leads, but Europe is anticipated to have the fastest growth.

title: Unmanned Glider Aircraft: An Innovative Solution for Small-Unit Logistics in the Pacific
originSummary: The article explores the use of unmanned glider aircraft for small-unit logistics in the western Pacific, highlighting the drawbacks of current resupply methods and the benefits of using gliders for stealth and successful missions.
It mentions two glider prototypes, the TACAD Glider and GD-2000 Glider, and discusses their capabilities, including low cost, disposability, and potential for swarming and decoy tactics.
The article recommends increased investment and development in unmanned glider technology for the Navy-Marine Corps team, while also acknowledging alternative resupply options and considerations.

title: UAE Orders 100 Locally Developed Reach-S UAS
originSummary: The United Arab Emirates (UAE) has placed an order for 100 Reach-S tactical unmanned air systems (UAS) developed by the Edge Group, marking the UAE military's first purchase of a locally developed fixed-wing UAS.
The Reach-S UAS has impressive specifications, including a maximum takeoff weight of 640 kg, a payload capacity of 120 kg, and an endurance of 24 hours.
The contract will be managed by Edge's Abu Dhabi Autonomous Systems Investments, and the aircraft will potentially be equipped with lightweight munitions developed by the group.

title: Unmanned Mojave conducts successful trials aboard UK's HMS Prince of Wales
originSummary: General Atomics Aeronautical Systems' Mojave UAV has performed its first trial from the UK Royal Navy's HMS Prince of Wales aircraft carrier off the US East Coast.
It is the first time a remote piloted air system of this size has operated from an aircraft carrier outside the US.
The Mojave has a 17m wingspan and can carry four Lockheed Martin AGM-114 Hellfire air-to-surface missiles.

title: Houma Airport Prepares for Electric Aircraft and Fire Safety
originSummary: The Houma Terrebonne Airport in Louisiana is preparing to support electric aircraft and is partnering with BETA to conduct a battery charging study.
The airport aims to complete the study within the next 30-40 days and is also upgrading its electrical service and implementing a smart microgrid.
The project's goal is to create a template for other airports to follow when accommodating electric aircraft, and fire prevention standards are being developed for vertiports with electric aircraft.

title: Royal Navy Conducts European First: Trial of Uncrewed AircraftShephard
originSummary: The Royal Navy has achieved a first in Europe by successfully testing an uncrewed aircraft from an aircraft carrier.
The trial involved the largest crewless machine ever flown outside of the US Navy.

The aircraft, named "Mojave," operated remotely and successfully performed takeoff and landing on the HMS Prince of Wales, demonstrating the integration of uncrewed air systems with crewed aircraft in maritime aviation.
